caption: Awesome patio. Really great wine list. Pizza is good, but it's a thicker crust (don't come here expecting NY style 'za). Salads and other dishes like the meatballs w/ Ricotta are exceptional. They have heaters too for colder nights.
(Translated by Google) Very good attention  (Original) Muy buena atención
Amazing pizza and beer selection! We enjoyed the outdoor patio setup with heat lamps
Delicious! It's a huge, thick pizza that's why it costs more.

We enjoyed a nice pizza with a couple of beers on a chilly Friday evening.  They have plenty of heaters on the patio and all tables are nicely spaced.  Pizza was fabulous, we created our own with the ala carte topping choices.  Beer selection was good for covid times.  Interesting tidbit, they Automatically add 20% tip to all bills.  I believe this defeats the purpose of tipping, I give more to great service and less for mediocre.  I would rather have it left up to me.
Great place for slices and beer to go!

Sonny's is a special place.  They have a shorter menu then most places but honestly that's a good thing.  Everything they do, they do it well.  The pizza is a grandma/sicilian (think frozen Elios but amazing and fresh) style and it's awesome. The cocktails, wine, and beer selections are all excellent and rotate frequently.  No Kisses is the retro cocktail bar that you walk through to access their pizza garden and it's equally impressive.  Seriously just go with a few friends, hang out in the pizza garden, and have a good time - anytime of the year.
One of my faves
SO GOOD! Super friendly staff, fantastic food and really strong cocktails. Great Covid spot!
Holy Smokes this place has some great pizza. If you're in the area and in the mood for pizza that has a great base (crust, cheese, sauce) plan on giving Sonny's a shot.  It's worth it!
As much as we wanted to eat the entire pizza in one setting, it was just too large. But we look forward to leftovers and trying again.
Pizza is whack.  Call Mario’s in Arlington.
Great pizza, amazing vibe. Dog friendly. Beautiful outdoor seating. One of my fav neighborhood restaurants!

Sonny's Pizza serves up excellent Detroit-style-ish pizza slices and pies. Four standard options plus a rotating special. Also sandwiches and hearty salads and sides. Craft beers (draft and bottle) and wine are on the menu, and it's connected to the adjacent No Kisses Bar. Great place for pizza fans. Popular with families on the weekends.
Pretty sweet spot for a quick bite.
The pizza has gotten much better, the salads are lowkey amazing, and the service is great.

Pretty decent spot. We went early, at the family friendly hour 6pm) and didn't have trouble finding street parking or a table. I like that you order at the bar. The pizza is bready and the crust has a good crunch. They could stand a bit more cheese. I recommend ordering by the slice to try more than one topping selection. I liked the sausage and peppers best!
The crust has the perfect amount of crunch
Tasty food, fair prices, great atmosphere.
Great Italian food.
Sonny's had solid, Sicilian pizza; really good, especially late at night after a drink or two at Colony Club.
Love the vibe but the pizza takes mad long for a to go order...ordered a pie when it was super slow and it took 25 minutes to come out. Oy.

I wish this place was closer to me bc I would go all the time. I had been wanting to visit forever and came across it during Open Streets. I was not disappointed! I got the mushroom pizza and it was fantastic!
Such a fantastic venue and the pizza is to die for. Definitely going to become my new regular pizza place!
Best pepperoni pizza I’ve had in DC

The back patio is really pretty and makes the whole visit worth it. Some of the pricing on the bottles and cans they had were really outlandish, but there were affordable options too. Didn't have the food but will next time, smelled good!

The pizzas are good, but I'm all in for the meatballs and chicken parm. Not a big fan of the limited wine selection (some odd, funky labels), but they do pair well with the food. Glad to see this addition to the neighborhood.
The Pepperoni Slice and the Meatballs with Ricotta were divine.  I've also heard good things about the Eggplant Parmesan.
Not great pizza.  Crust is slightly soggy.  Not a lot of flavor.  It looks better than it tastes..
Delicious pizza and many other options go check it out...
My favorite pizza in the city.  It's chewy and crunchy in all the right places. Pair that with a steady supply of Grimm Ales and I couldn't be happier.

Place was very well decorated, too bad the pizza was sub par. Slices were reasonably priced but the whole pie was ridiculously expensive. The pizza was just very plain and lacking in flavor, although quite crunchy. Was hoping to add another favorite to the neighborhood but with Timber so close by there’s just no comparison.
Fast friendly service. Clean interior. Nice beers. Yummy appetizers.  Great salads. Delicious and healthy square pizza. All priced right. Eat in or take out. Yummy
The spicy pizza was on point!

Finally got to visit Sonny’s pizza. I found out about it on Instagram, and it didn’t disappoint. The sauce and crust are very delicious, the sauce definitely has a bit of a kick on it. They have a big beer/pizza garden in the back which has great atmosphere. Great service, great food, great experience. Definitely coming back
Everything is fresh

Crispy, crusty and consistently delicious pizza. It reminds me so much of my favorite pizza joint in SoHo - this is a second runner up! The garlic knots are worth ordering while you wait for your pizza, just make sure to save room for the slices.
Really good service, nice atmosphere, very tasty pizza.
Great pizza and beer, great location
Too disorganized need better coordination of orders

Beautiful interior, delicious food and beverages, and fast, friendly service. Even when this place is packed, it doesn't take too long to get your food. I will say I think the texture on the crust is more enjoyable (more deeply satisfying in its crunchy counterpoint to its soft interior and layered toppings) when ordering individual slices that are presumably rebaked to achieve this effect. Drop on by, you won't be disappointed.

Pretty good pizza and exceptionally cool environment. It has an old school pizza parlor feel inside, and a nice and spacious outdoor seating area for when the weather's nice. I only had their pizza, but their meatballs looked good as well. The pizza is dense, but the sauce has good flavor. They used lots of fresh basil which was a plus.
You know, it was just okay.

I ordered the special pizza they suggested it had spicy salami, cheese, onions and oregano. The pizza was average tasting, the cheese on it was hard. Their beer on tap was good. Service is average on the bad side. We waited more than ten minutes per slice of pizza.

One of the best tasting. pizza's in DC.  The cheese is delicious, tomatoes taste like summertime and the crust is full of flavor, cooked just right and just crunchy enough w/ just a little char!  It was refreshing to get a great pizza that wasn't trying to be a Neapolitan pie.  Sonny's is a delicious pie just like my Italian Grandma used to make.  We loved it and can't wait to go back, and it's not around the corner for us.

Fantastic new place. Love the classic pizzeria/hip vibe. The servings are delightfully lavish and shareable (their “small” salad is a lovely huge mound of beautiful greens!) and the pizza is hearty and satisfying. Also, a brilliant layout, combined with the neighboring cafe Colony Club, a slick bar section with a very cool entryway, and an awesome outdoor patio area. Excited to hit this place up in the summer, too! 🙌🏻
Great atmosphere. Fantastic Pizza. Loved the meatballs. Quick service after standing In a busy line.
Great local pizza joint. Glad its in the neighborhood
Worth the trip !! Great pizza

Looks like your old school neighborhood pizza place, but (happily) doesn't taste like it and (sadly) ain't priced like it.  We stopped in here after hearing it finally opened a few days ago and ordered a large pizza to share at home. I'm pretty sure it was the Pizza Don - tomatoes, mozzarella, salami, oregano, and arugula.  Pizza was delicious and really unique. I don't think there is a lot of good sicilian-style pizza in the area so this is a treat. The crust is fairly thick with a perfectly crunchy bottom, the cheese and oregano were generous, the salami was wonderful, and it was all brought together by a super tasty drizzle of really nice fresh olive oil. The whole flavor profile and structure of the pizza is quite different from most of the other higher-end pizza places in DC, which tend to be Neapolitan style. This really tastes like a very familiar and comforting flavor profile, elevated by really thoughtful high-quality ingredients.  They only serve pizza in two sizes: either by the slice or by the whole pie. We got a whole pie, which says it feeds 3-4, and that seems right. The two of us each ate two slices (the pie has 8) and felt pretty full. Eating 3 slices would probably have left me feeling way overstuffed. We'll both have leftovers for lunch tomorrow.  My only complaint is the price here - while the aesthetic and decor feel like a welcoming pizza joint out of the 70s, our large pie was $32 or $34, which strikes me as borderline unheard of. That said, the pizza is very good and that $30+ comfortably turns into (for us) 4 servings of the stuff, so maybe it's justifiable - judge for yourself. We didn't try any of the individual slices, but they had simpler toppings and less eye-popping prices - about $4 a slice, depending on your selection. Maybe the solution for these guys is to offer a 4-slice pie priced at closer to $15 to avoid customers' sticker shock?  It was already pretty busy on a Sunday evening - there wasn't a wait for a table but it was crowded and buzzing. Presumably once word gets out it will be even more of a zoo - go soon!  Also note - they aren't taking take out orders by phone yet, so for now you'll have to drop by in person if you want to get pizza to go.
Great pizza and sandwiches, very cool space to eat out back too!
Very good pizza. I ordered a full pepperoni for myself and only finished 3 of the 8 slices. They do by the slice but I’m looking forward to having leftovers tomorrow.
Food was decent. Great addition to the neighborhood. By the slice pizza reasonable priced. Whole pies are way over priced. Garlic knots were great

We came for the grand opening and Sonny’s did not disappoint. We ordered the Pizza Don which is topped with arugula and salami. The Crust was A+ as well as the vibe of the restaurant. Definitely coming back 👍👍
